TEI.2.document_title: Hugh McGuffin to Stephen F. Austin, 08-18-1824

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 877

div1.p: I should have visited your Country ere this only on account of Mrs. McGuffin going to the warm Springs She will return about the fifteenth of Sept. Shortly after which I will set out for that place there is nothing worthy of Communicating to you now the Mule that your Brother left with me I Delivered to his order about two weeks ago the Horse is not here at present but I think he will [be] in a short time when I go on there I will bring him with me.—
Write me if you have any oportunity
P. S. I send your Muscetoe Barr by Mr. House that you left at Mr. Jas. Dennys also your Spanish Dictionary H. McG.
[Addressed:] Coln. S. F. Austin—Brazos—Per Mr. House.
